parameters: \pop[2]It's the most beautiful place I've ever seen in my life.
\pop[2]It almost resembles Isaac's store, but on a much grander scale.
\pop[2]Whoever built this place probably had no limits on their budget.
\pop[2]We stick close to Isaac, who's tapping away at his phone.
\pop[2]I'm not sure what he's doing, but it's clearly important.
\pop[3]Isaac, are you sure we should be here?
\pop[2]Dante tilts his head up toward a bunch of cameras watching the atrium.
\pop[2]If anyone was looking, they'd know that Isaac didn't come alone.
\pop[2]A group coming to an interview? Definitely suspicious.
\pop[3]The cameras are on us. That's pretty incriminating...
\pop[2]He tilts his phone toward us, so we can all take a look.
I'm feeding them a recording of the \c[14]first\c[0] one.
If they're watching, they have no idea you're here.
\pop[3]Well, \c[14]they\c[0] definitely know you brought us in.
\pop[2]Kyron looks over at the reception desk.
\pop[2]Someone is behind it, typing away at a computer.
\pop[2]Actually, that was the only person in the entire atrium.
\pop[2]Makes sense. Everyone was probably in the town square.
\pop[2]That, or in their office, glued to their phone or TV.
\pop[2]Nobody wanted to miss what would happen...
\pop[2]And that worked out in our benefit. Great thinking, Isaac.
\pop[4]Hold on, I'll take care of them.
\pop[4]I'll make sure they don't get in our way.
\pop[2]He smirks and starts to walk toward the desk.
\pop[2]I want to watch him, but I'm distracted for a couple moments.
\pop[2]This atrium is so... amazing. The sun roof really sells it, though.
\pop[2]Those beams of light piercing through the trees...
\pop[2]It's clear that this design choice was intentional.
\pop[2]But did it have a deeper meaning of any sort?
\pop[2]To me, it almost screams "\c[10]Argus\c[0], home of \c[17]Komorebi\c[0]."
\pop[2]Definitely adds to the conspiracy theory that they were the cause of the visions.
\pop[2]It couldn't be true, though. Right now, even the Nostalgia Tech is just a concept.
\pop[2]The future is impacting the way almost everybody lives in the present.
\pop[2]Normally, cause and effect would dictate that it's the other way around.
\pop[2]But things don't seem to work like that in this world...
\pop[2]It's possible that the true cause of \c[17]Komorebi\c[0] hasn't even \c[14]happened\c[0] yet.
\pop[2]As confusing as that is, it definitely makes sense.
\pop[2]I remember what we talked about in the hotel room.
\pop[2]As you get older, your \c[17]Komorebi\c[0] is destined to become a vision of the past.
\pop[2]Well, not \c[14]the\c[0] past, but an alternate one. Interesting to think about.
\pop[2]Part of me wonders if this Nostalgia Technology has anything to do with it.
\pop[2]A technology dedicated to cracking open the past, and allowing interaction...
\pop[2]There's no way \c[14]that\c[0] could go wrong. Right...?
\pop[2]I decide to watch Isaac, instead of lose myself in thought.
\pop[2]He's engaged in what appears to be a friendly conversation with the receptionist.
\pop[2]I have no idea what they're talking about, but everything seems to be going fine.
\pop[2]It's a little easier to breathe, too, knowing that those cameras aren't capturing me.
\pop[2]A little ironic in the face of some of my "theories". But comfort is still comfort.
\pop[2]I see the receptionist stand up from their desk, and go into a room behind them.
\pop[2]Isaac then turns and waves at us, before pressing a button on his phone.
\pop[2]The door immediately shuts, and we hear a locking noise echo through the atrium.
\pop[2]He walks back to us, and we hear the receptionist bang on the door, trying to get out.
\pop[4]Like I said, I could technically make it work on \c[14]any\c[0] door.
\pop[4]After we're done. We can't risk anything, Dante.
Follow me, we need to keep this moving.
\pop[4]They have food, and they can still watch the town square.
Every TV in this building is gonna be streaming it soon.
\pop[4]What did you \c[14]expect\c[0] me to do once we were in here?
Ask them to march me down to the server room?
\pop[3]So that's where we're going, I guess?
But first, I need to get back to that computer.
\pop[2]Isaac runs back over to the reception desk, and we follow him.
\pop[2]He climbs over the counter, and jumps to the other side.
\pop[2]Taking a cord out of his pocket, he plugs his phone into the PC.
\pop[2]Isaac starts typing. It's an impressive display of speed.
\pop[2]The receptionist is still banging on the door, begging for us to let them out.
You're actually \c[14]more\c[0] safe in that room, okay?
That door is set to a timer. It'll unlock in thirty minutes.
Just relax, and watch the broadcast of the town square.
\pop[3]Okay, but what seeds are you planting?
\pop[4]I need to give us all admin-access.
The server room is deep underground, and super classified.
\pop[2]Dante sighs, and holds out his phone.
\pop[4]You've given it to me \c[14]plenty\c[0] of times.
\pop[2]He presses the enter key on the keyboard, and then unplugs his phone.
\pop[2]Jumping back over the desk, he smiles at us, like he's accomplished an impossible task.
\pop[2]A moment later, all of our phones go off. I take mine out, and look at it.
\pop[4]We should all be able to take the elevator down, now.
But we still need to take care of the other employees.
\pop[2]What did Isaac say to Dante? "You've given it to me plenty of times"?
\pop[2]Whatever he did, apparently he set it up a while ago.
\pop[2]But my phone went off, as well...
Had to leave my lunch at home on purpose, though.
\pop[4]You prepared all of our phones for this...?
\pop[4]Saves me time from doing it now.
Especially since we're gonna be on the clock.
\pop[2]He presses a button on his phone, and suddenly, the atrium is dark.
\pop[2]Isaac must've killed the power. The sunroof only slightly illuminates my surroundings.
\pop[2]But a moment later, everything turns back on. What was that...?
\pop[2]He's immediately cut off as an alarm starts blaring.
\pop[2]My heart basically stops. Did we trigger some sort of security?
\pop[2]Oh, this is it, isn't it? This is where we get caught, and locked up.
\pop[2]It's telling everyone that the building is compromised, and they should seek out a saferoom.
\pop[2]It repeats this over and over, as I start to see people run around.
\pop[2]Suddenly, the atrium is bursting with activity.
\pop[4]I probably should've mentioned that this was part of my plan.
\pop[2]His confidence is infectious, I'll give him \c[14]that\c[0] much.
It's time to blend in for a little bit.
